title: Textile, late 18th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block printed on plain weave
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment
description: Fragment of printed fabric: this section having a group of flowers with roses predominating on the left side and a standing classical female figure on the right. The woman holds an apple (?) in her out-stretched right hand and an olive branch in her right arm. Morning glory vines tie the motifs together.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, late 18th century.
late 18th century. Medium: cotton
